intro: Junellia scoparia var. puberula, commonly known as the pubescent junellia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, bushy growth form. Its leaves are hairy, giving it the "puberula" designation, and its small white flowers bloom in late summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
